name: Fluorine
educationalNotes: Most reactive element known - reacts with nearly everything! Fluorine gas was isolated in 1886 and immediately caused serious injuries (chemist Humphry Davy damaged his eyes and teeth). Added to toothpaste (0.1%) to strengthen tooth enamel and prevent cavities - has saved millions from dental decay. Uranium enrichment for nuclear reactors uses uranium hexafluoride (UF₆). CFCs (chlorofluorocarbons) with fluorine damaged the ozone layer. Extremely toxic in high concentrations.

diffusion.usage: Sum atomic contributions for compound Σv, then: D_AB = 0.00143×T^1.75 / (P × M_AB^0.5 × (Σv_A^(1/3) + Σv_B^(1/3))²)
